thread.title: Court OKs defense lawyers’ request for second autopsy on Bella Bond
thread.title_full: Court OKs defense lawyers’ request for second autopsy on Bella Bond | Boston Herald

author: Antonio Planas
title: Court OKs defense lawyers’ request for second autopsy on Bella Bond
text:
Lawyers for the mother and ex-boyfriend charged in the death of Bella Bond — the little girl dubbed “Baby Doe” who was found in a trash bag on Deer Island in June — have been given the OK for their own medical experts to conduct a second autopsy as they try to determine how the 2-year-old died.
“We want the evidence looked at by an independent expert ... to determine to the extent we can what did happen,” said attorney Jonathan Shapiro, whose client Michael McCarthy, 35, is charged with murder in Bella’s death. McCarthy and Bella’s mother, Rachelle Bond, 40 — who faces an accessory charge — both briefly appeared in Dorchester District Court today where Judge Lisa Ann Grant agreed to allow the defense to conduct their own autopsy on Bella. Prosecutors did not object to the defense motion.
Shapiro noted that the medical examiner’s office hasn’t determined a cause and manner of death for the little girl found discarded in a trash bag on the Boston Harbor June 25 by a dog walker.
Bond’s lawyer, Janice Bassil, said her client didn’t want a second autopsy because it’s really hard for her but it was necessary to assess her statements to investigators and whether her statements are corroborated by medical evidence.
“I wanted my own person to give me a second opinion,” Bassil said.
Both Bassil and Shapiro said they will have different experts conduct the autopsy, but Shapiro said he hopes they reach same conclusion.
In court, Bond bowed her head and was huddled in corner behind a glass partition while McCarthy stood several feet behind her looking on expressionless.
The pair, who were arrested last month and have pleaded not guilty, are due back in court Nov. 19 for a probable cause hearing. Bond remains held on $1 million bail, while there is no bail for McCarthy.
McCarthy’s father and brother left court without commenting.
Joseph Amoroso, Bella’s biological father, said after the hearing that he’s “disgusted” to see his ex-girlfriend Bond in court.
“I hope they find more evidence and more cause,” Amoroso said. “This is all about justice for Bella from here on out.”
